dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 524 RH: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify that the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency does not have the authority to disapprove a permit after it has been issued by the Secretary of the Army under section 404 of such Act.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. McKinley (for himself, Mr. Rahall, Mr. Gibbs, Mrs. Capito, Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Huelskamp, Mr. Griffith of Virginia, Mr. Duncan of South Carolina, Mr. Johnson of Ohio, Mr. Bucshon, and Mr. Kline) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Additional sponsors: Mr. Young of Alaska, Mr. Scalise, and Mr. Crawford
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify that the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency does not have the authority to disapprove a permit after it has been issued by the Secretary of the Army under section 404 of such Act.

section.header: Permits for dredged or fill material

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
